luad.base



enum LuaType;
Enumerates all Lua types.

String
string

Number
number

Nil
nil

Boolean
boolean

Function
function

Userdata
LightUserdata
userdata

Thread
thread

Nil nil;
Special value representing the Lua type and value nil.

Examples:
Useful for clearing keys in a table: 
	lua["n"] = 1.23;
	assert(lua.get!double("n") == 1.23);

	lua["n"] = nil;
	assert(lua["n"].type == LuaType.Nil);


class LuaObject;
Represents a reference to a Lua value of any type

LuaType type();
Type of referenced object

See Also:
LuaType

bool isNil();
Boolean whether or not the referenced object is nil

string toString();
Convert the referenced object into a textual representation.

The returned string is formatted exactly like the Lua 'tostring' function.

Returns:
string representation of referenced object

T to(T)();
Attempt to convert the referenced object to any D type.

bool opEquals(Object o);
Compares this object to another with Lua's equality semantics. Also, if the other object is not a LuaObject or a derived class of LuaObject, or the two refer to objects in different Lua states, this function returns false.
